page.title: 11Ancient Stone Circles
page.content: Unst was a place of some importance in Pictish times.Within our block, the remains of three Drudical circles can be seen.The largest,near the Kirk of Balliasta,appears as three concentric circles of stones, built above ground- level.The outer circle measures 67 feet across,and the diameters of the middle and inner circle are 54\ feet and 40 feet, respectively.A tumulus of stones-12 feet in diameter-in the middle suggests that this may have been a temple.One mile East,along the hill of Cussa Field,similar concentric circles,of smaller circumference,are seen.These are named the "Rounds of Tivla" on the O.S. Map and known locally as the "Fairy Rings".A third, smaller enclosure-consisting of only two circles,is located 80 feet from the "temple".The diameters of these circles are 22 feet and 17 feet.
